Key Arguments: The bill could infringe on free speech and healthy debate.
The definition of 'misinformation' as leading to 'harm' is subjective and difficult to police.
Concerns about ACMA and fact-checkers having too much power to determine misinformation.
Main Themes: Power and authority of regulatory bodies
Notable Quotes: Is Australia a free country or not? If the answer is 'yes' then we should be free to state our opinions and beliefs on any one subject just as others are free to disregard it if they have opposing views.
It is simply not possible to police such subjectivity.
